Donald Trump's long-standing obsession with military parades
subhead: More than 6,000 soldiers are set to march in Washington on Saturday to mark the 250th anniversary of the United States Armed Forces. In 2017, the US president was impressed by the July 14 Bastille Day parade on the Champs-Elysées in Paris, to which President Macron had invited him.

title: In Ukraine, the Dnipropetrovsk region faces threats of a Russian breakthrough toward Pokrovsk
subhead: Moscow, which has aimed to seize the strategic city in the Donetsk region, says it has crossed the administrative border. A claim Kyiv denies.

title: 'Can robots beat the wolves of Wall Street?'
subhead: According to a study conducted by Stanford University, artificial intelligence has outperformed 93% of US equity mutual fund managers. So it is hardly surprising that the asset management industry is doubling down on technology, observes Le Monde columnist Isabelle Chaperon.

title: Thomas Piketty: 'Opponents of the tax on the ultra-wealthy lack historical perspective'
subhead: After France's Sénat voted against a 2% wealth tax for people whose worth exceeds €100 million, the economist argues that the scale of France's debt and funding needs for social and climate challenges will soon require even more radical redistributive measures.

Two Jewish sisters' fight to honor the couple who hid them during the Holocaust
subhead: Arlette and Madeleine Testyler campaigned so that Jeanne and Jean Philippeau, who sheltered them during World War II, be recognized as Righteous Among the Nations. After some hesitation from the mayor, the town of Vendôme is organizing a ceremony on June 16 in which they will be honored by the Yad Vashem Institute.

title: Rare 16th-century shipwreck found at record depth in French waters
subhead: The shattered wreck of an Italian merchant vessel was accidentally discovered in March in the deep waters of the Gulf of Saint-Tropez by the French Navy, 2,500 meters below sea level.

title: The Islamic Republic of Iran, Netanyahu's favorite enemy for 30 years
subhead: Since his rise to prominence on the Israeli political stage in the early 1990s, Israeli Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu has repeatedly insisted that the regime in Tehran poses an 'existential threat' to Israel.
